oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-04-06 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from April 6, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ray Price and Marty Robbins (hosts/performers), and performers the Old Hickory Singers, Chet Atkins, and Minnie Pearl. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. On this show, Hal Cook, VP of sales at Columbia Records, presents Marty Robbins and Ray Price with the Columbia Records Golden Guitar award. It is announced that this is the 913th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ray Price; Marty Robbins; Old Hickory Singers; Cherokee Cowboys; Chet Atkins; Minnie Pearl
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Marty Robbins and Ray Price -- Singing The Blues / Crazy Arms (medley) (Marty Robbins, Ray Price) -- Ray Price introduces the Old Hickory Singers -- Oh, You Beautiful Doll (Old Hickory Singers) -- Ray Price talks -- I'll Be There (Ray Price and the Cherokee Cowboys) -- Prince Albert commercial (Ray Price, Marty Robbins) -- Sally Gooden -- Marty Robbins talks -- Knee Deep In The Blues (Marty Robbins) -- Marty Robbins and Ray Price introduce Chet Atkins -- (Back Home Again In) Indiana (Chet Atkins) -- Marty Robbins and Ray Price introduce Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Turner, Grant; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Old Hickory Singers; Cook, Hal (music executive); Hughes, Randy, 1928-1963; Price, Ray, 1926-2013; Cherokee Cowboys (Musical group); Robbins, Marty
